Glutathione is considered the most important molecule in life because it is connected to over 1,500 essential metabolic functions in the body. Scientific evidence suggests that higher levels of glutathione in the body enhance the ability to combat diseases, while lower levels can lead to the development of chronic illnesses.

Immunocal is mentioned as a supplement that can potentially increase glutathione levels in the body. While it does not directly cause weight loss, it may indirectly contribute to a healthier body composition by reducing inflammation and optimizing immune and metabolic function.

When comparing Immunocal to other antioxidants like vitamin C or resveratrol, it is noted that they are complementary and synergistic. Immunocal acts as an enhancer for other antioxidants, recycling and amplifying their effects. Ideally, a combination of antioxidants is recommended.

One important aspect mentioned is that Immunocal can increase glutathione levels in all cells of the body, including plasma, tissues, and organs. It can be used both as a preventive measure in healthy individuals and as a supportive treatment for various medical conditions associated with low glutathione levels.

Additional topics related to glutathione include its involvement in mental health, reproductive health and pregnancy, athletic performance, skin health and aesthetics, support during chemotherapy for cancer, detoxification, cellular energy production, and its role as the master antioxidant in the body.

It is also mentioned that glutathione levels can be measured through blood tests (erythrocytes) or by isolating lymphocytes from blood samples. Persons with certain genetic variations may have lower basal glutathione levels or a deficient response to oxidative stress. While other antioxidants can enhance their effects when glutathione levels are adequate, they do not replace glutathione as the master antioxidant.

Glutathione plays a crucial role in supporting the body in several ways. It acts as a powerful antioxidant, neutralizing harmful free radicals and protecting cells from oxidative stress. Glutathione also aids in detoxification processes, particularly in the liver, by binding to and eliminating toxins and harmful substances from the body. Additionally, it supports the immune system by stimulating the development and activity of white blood cells, which are responsible for fighting off germs, viruses, and cancerous cells. Glutathione is also involved in the production of cellular energy and helps maintain physical and mental energy levels. It is considered the master antioxidant as it can regenerate other antioxidants like vitamins C and E, enhancing their effectiveness in combating oxidative stress. However, it is important to note that oral glutathione supplementation does not effectively elevate systemic or intracellular levels of glutathione, as it degrades rapidly in the digestive system. The most effective way to increase glutathione levels is by consuming precursor amino acids, which can be found in supplements like Immunocal. Immunocal provides a specific type of cysteine, a limiting amino acid in glutathione synthesis, which supports the synthesis of glutathione within cells.

how can i legally protect my self if i am not saving money as promised, what clause or warranty i can use to protect or make a claim?

To legally protect yourself if you are not saving money as promised, you can consider the following clauses or warranties to include in your contract:

1. Performance Guarantee: Include a clause in the contract that guarantees the performance of the savings promised. This clause should outline the specific savings targets and the consequences if these targets are not met. For example, you can include provisions for reimbursement or compensation if the promised savings are not achieved.

2. Termination Clause: Include a termination clause that allows you to terminate the contract if the savings targets are consistently not met. This clause should specify the conditions under which termination can occur and the process for notifying the other party.

3. Dispute Resolution Clause: Include a dispute resolution clause that outlines the process for resolving any disputes related to the savings not being achieved. This can include mediation, arbitration, or litigation, depending on your preferences and the applicable laws in your jurisdiction.

4. Warranty of Fitness for Purpose: Include a warranty clause that states that the service provided will be fit for the purpose of achieving the promised savings. This means that the service provider guarantees that their service will be effective in helping you save money as promised.

5. Indemnity Clause: Include an indemnity clause that protects you from any losses or damages incurred as a result of not achieving the promised savings. This clause should state that the service provider will be responsible for compensating you for any financial losses or damages suffered due to their failure to meet their obligations.

It is important to consult with an attorney to ensure that these clauses are drafted properly and are enforceable in your jurisdiction. Additionally, it is recommended to carefully review any contracts or agreements before signing them to ensure that they include the necessary protections for you as the customer.

And last, before we get started, you need one other piece of advice:   Keep this to yourself.   All of Dr. Eifrigâ€™s tips are perfectly legal. But as he says, â€œThat doesnâ€™t mean the government   wants   you to do these thingsâ€¦ To the contrary, if too many people start talking about these things and taking these steps, the government could easily change the rules.â€ 42  â€” Chapter 2 â€”  Three Tips to Keep Your Wealth Out of the United States  By Dr. David Eifrig  TIP No. 1: Open a Foreign Bank Account â€“ Soon  If you open up a foreign financial account with less than $10,000, you  do not have to report the assets. This comes under the Foreign Bank and  Financial Authority (FBAR) regulations, and the IRS states you only have  to report if:  â€¢   You have financial interest in, signature authority, or other  authority over one or more accounts in a foreign country.  â€¢   The aggregate value of all foreign financial ac omething were to hap- pen â€“ even if you couldnâ€™t go to a pharmacy for a few days â€“ do you think  people are prepared for that?  No way, nobody even considers what it would be like if you couldnâ€™t get medicine or go to the grocery store for a week or a month at a time. If you require medication for your healthâ€¦  Stansberry Research:   Or your kidsâ€¦  Porter:   Right, especially if youâ€™re a diabetic or something like that. Be- lieve me, those things will be the most important things to have stockpiled. 97  Stansberry Research:   Even basic antibiotics.  Porter:   Yes, itâ€™s smart to have a secret stash of antibiotics and first-aid  supplies. I donâ€™t want you to think Iâ€™m a â€œdoomsday prepperâ€â€¦ Iâ€™m not. I donâ€™t think it makes any sense to believe you can live in a hole in the  ground for a year. But I definitely believe in having the resources and the  ability to take care of yourself and your family for a seven- to 10-day emer- gency periodâ€¦ and ideally having the wherewithal to be able to leave the country if the crisis were to get worse.  Stansberry Research:   Itâ€™s always smart to have an exit strategyâ€¦  Porter:   Definitely. I would have an escape plan, not a hole in the ground. Donâ€™t end up with so few large positions that a catastrophe in one stock wipes out all your other gains for the year.  The last part of our strategy (Step 5) to always beating the mar- ket is do everything you can to avoid the damage from fees and taxes, to maximize your long-term, compound returns . Whenever possible, keep your assets in vehicles that allow you to com-  pound your investments tax-free. Minimize trading and fees, which en - rich your broker, not you. Look for companies whose management is  well-known for doing tax-efficient deals and rewarding shareholders in tax-efficient ways. Based on the provided information, here is a detailed analysis of the coverage provided by this health insurance policy:

1. Coverage Percentage: The coverage provided by the policy varies based on the plan level chosen. The coverage percentages for the first $100,000 pesos of expenses and the rest of the expenses are as follows:

- Premium Plan: 50% for the first $100,000 pesos and 25% for the rest of the expenses.
- Platinum Plan: 40% for the first $100,000 pesos and 20% for the rest of the expenses.
- Ãndigo Plan: 30% for the first $100,000 pesos and 15% for the rest of the expenses.
- Ãmbar Plan: 30% for the first $100,000 pesos and 15% for the rest of the expenses.
- Cuarzo Plan: 20% for the first $100,000 pesos and 10% for the rest of the expenses.

2. Coinsurance: The policy also includes a coinsurance feature, which represents the percentage of expenses that the insured has to pay after the deductible has been met. The coinsurance amounts depend on the coinsurance level chosen:

- 5% and 10% Coinsurance: The maximum coinsurance amount (tope de coaseguro) is $75,500.
- 15% and 20% Coinsurance: The maximum coinsurance amount (tope de coaseguro) is $112,500.

3. Elimination or Reduction of Waiting Periods: The insured is eligible for a reduction in waiting periods for medical or surgical treatments, provided that they had coverage for major medical expenses from March 26, 2010, to March 26, 2023. Pre-existing conditions or accidents that occurred before the specified date are excluded from coverage.

4. Penalty for Accessing Higher-Level Hospitals: If the insured accesses hospitals of a higher level than what is contracted, a penalty is applied. The penalty is 15 percentage points for each level ascended. If the treatment is carried out in an immediate higher level, a maximum penalty cap of $66,500 is applied.

5. Purchase or Rental of Orthopedic Appliances, Prostheses, and Medical Devices: The policy covers the purchase or rental of orthopedic appliances, prostheses, and medical devices required due to a covered illness or accident. The amounts covered are as follows:

- Prostheses: Up to $260,000 pesos.
- Medical Device or Orthopedic Appliance: Up to $647,000 pesos.

It's important to note that this analysis is based on the provided information, and it's always recommended to review the specific terms, conditions, and exclusions of the insurance policy to fully understand the coverage and benefits it provides.

title: que me cubre realmente esta poliza de seguro medico

messages.content: que me cubre realmente esta poliza de seguro medico

Based on the provided information, here is a detailed analysis of the coverage provided by this health insurance policy:

1. Coverage Percentage: The coverage provided by the policy varies based on the plan level chosen. The coverage percentages for the first $100,000 pesos of expenses and the rest of the expenses are as follows:

- Premium Plan: 50% for the first $100,000 pesos and 25% for the rest of the expenses.
- Platinum Plan: 40% for the first $100,000 pesos and 20% for the rest of the expenses.
- Ãndigo Plan: 30% for the first $100,000 pesos and 15% for the rest of the expenses.
- Ãmbar Plan: 30% for the first $100,000 pesos and 15% for the rest of the expenses.
- Cuarzo Plan: 20% for the first $100,000 pesos and 10% for the rest of the expenses.

2. Coinsurance: The policy also includes a coinsurance feature, which represents the percentage of expenses that the insured has to pay after the deductible has been met. The coinsurance amounts depend on the coinsurance level chosen:

- 5% and 10% Coinsurance: The maximum coinsurance amount (tope de coaseguro) is $75,500.
- 15% and 20% Coinsurance: The maximum coinsurance amount (tope de coaseguro) is $112,500.

3. Elimination or Reduction of Waiting Periods: The insured is eligible for a reduction in waiting periods for medical or surgical treatments, provided that they had coverage for major medical expenses from March 26, 2010, to March 26, 2023. Pre-existing conditions or accidents that occurred before the specified date are excluded from coverage.

4. Penalty for Accessing Higher-Level Hospitals: If the insured accesses hospitals of a higher level than what is contracted, a penalty is applied. The penalty is 15 percentage points for each level ascended. If the treatment is carried out in an immediate higher level, a maximum penalty cap of $66,500 is applied.

5. Purchase or Rental of Orthopedic Appliances, Prostheses, and Medical Devices: The policy covers the purchase or rental of orthopedic appliances, prostheses, and medical devices required due to a covered illness or accident. The amounts covered are as follows:

- Prostheses: Up to $260,000 pesos.
- Medical Device or Orthopedic Appliance: Up to $647,000 pesos.

It's important to note that this analysis is based on the provided information, and it's always recommended to review the specific terms, conditions, and exclusions of the insurance policy to fully understand the coverage and benefits it provides.

messages.content: give me the key components that i should be aware of this contract as the home owner  Search for relevant information in the context below and use it to answer user questions exhaustively and deeply using numbered list and thorough analysis.  If the context does not provide relevant answer to the question, mention that PDF provided is not relevant to question and try to relate the question to the context.  Context: 34861  11/24/2021  11/21/2021 Page 1  TEXAS TERMS AND DISCLOSURES  KNOW YOUR RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES UNDER THE LAW. You are about to enter into a transaction to build a new home or remodel existing residential property. Texas law requires Your contractor to provide You with this brief overview of some of Your rights, responsibilities, and risks in this transaction. CONVEYANCE TO CONTRACTOR NOT REQUIRED. Your contractor may not require You to convey Your real property to Your contractor as a condition to the agreement for the construction of improvements on Your property. KNOW YOUR CONTRACTOR. Before You enter into Your agreement for the construction of improvements to Your real property, make sure that You have investigated Your contractor. Obtain and verify references from other people who have used the contractor for the type and size of construction project on Your property. GET IT IN WRITING. Make sure that You have a written agreement with Your contractor that includes: (1) a description of the work the contractor is to perform; (2) the required or estimated time for completion of the work; (3) the cost of the work or how the cost will be determined; and (4) the procedure and method of payment, including provisions for  statutory retainage and conditions for final payment. If Your contractor made a promise, warranty, or representation  to You concerning the work the contractor is to perform, make sure that promise, warranty, or representation  is specified in the written agreement. An oral promise that is not included in the written agreement may not be  enforceable under Texas law. READ BEFORE YOU SIGN. Do not sign any document before You have read and understood it. NEVER SIGN A DOCUMENT THAT INCLUDES AN UNTRUE STATEMENT. Take Your time in reviewing documents. If You borrow money from a lender to pay for the improvements, You are entitled to have the loan closing documents furnished to You for review at least one business day before the closing. Do not wa losing documents furnished to You for review at least one business day before the closing. Do not waive this requirement unless a  bona fide emergency or another good cause exists, and make sure You understand the documents before You sign  them. If You fail to comply with the terms of the documents, You could lose Your property. You are entitled to have Your own attorney review any documents. If You have any question about the meaning of a document, consult an attorney. GET A LIST OF SUBCONTRACTORS AND SUPPLIERS. Before construction commences, Your contractor is required to provide You with a list of the subcontractors and suppliers the contractor intends to use on Your project. Your contractor is required to supply updated information on any subcontractors and suppliers added after the list is provided. Your contractor is not required to supply this information if You sign a written waiver of Your rights to receive this information. MONITOR THE WORK. Lenders and governmental authorities may inspect the work in progress from time to time for their own purposes. These inspections are not intended as quality control inspections. Quality control is a matter for You and Your contractor. To ensure that Your home is being constructed in accordance with Your wishes and  specifications, You should inspect the work Yourself or have Your own independent inspector review the work in  progress. MONITOR PAYMENTS. If You use a lender, Your lender is required to provide You with a periodic statement showing the money disbursed by the lender from the proceeds of Your loan. Each time Your contractor requests payment from You or Your lender for work performed, Your contractor is also required to furnish You with a disbursement statement that lists the name and address of each subcontractor or supplier that the contractor intends to pay from the requested funds. Review these statements and make sure that the money is being properly disbursed. CLAIMS BY SUBCONTRACTORS AND SUPPLIERS. U o furnish You with an affidavit stating that all bills have been paid. If the contractor discloses any unpaid bill in the affidavit, You should withhold  payment in the amount of the unpaid bill until You receive a waiver of lien or release from that subcontractor or supplier. OBTAIN TITLE INSURANCE PROTECTION. You may be able to obtain a title insurance policy to insure that the title to Your property and the existing improvements on Your property are free from liens claimed by subcontractors and suppliers. If Your policy is issued before the improvements are completed and covers the value of the improvements  to be completed, You should obtain, on the completion of the improvements and as a condition of Your final payment, a â€˜completion of improvementsâ€™ policy endorsement. This endorsement will protect Your property from liens claimed  by subcontractors and suppliers that may arise from the date the original title policy is issued to the date of the endorsement. (Texas Property Code Â§ 53.255.)  IMPORTANT NOTICE: You and Your contractor are responsible for meeting the terms and conditions of this contract. If You sign this contract and You fail to meet the terms and conditions of payment, You may become liable and Your property may be subject to a lien for the unpaid amount. KNOW YOUR RIGHTS AND DUTIES UNDER THE LAW. (Texas Property Code Â§ 41.007.)  This contract is subject to Chapter 27 of the Texas Property Code.   The provisions of that chapter may affect Your right to recover damages arising from a construction defect.   If You have a complaint  concerning a construction defect and that defect has not been corrected as may be required by law  or by contract, You must provide the notice required by Chapter 27 of the Texas Property Code to the contractor by certified mail, return receipt requested, not later than the 60th day before the date You file DocuSign Envelope ID: 444F7112-B0A4-4983-B7F1-4299D733E15A Page 3  suit to recover damages in a court of law or in ope ID: 444F7112-B0A4-4983-B7F1-4299D733E15A Page 3  suit to recover damages in a court of law or initiate arbitration.   The notice must refer to Chapter 27 of the Texas Property Code and must describe the construction defect.   If requested by the contractor, You must provide the contractor an opportunity to inspect and cure the defect as provided by Section 27.004  of the Texas Property Code. (Texas Property Code Â§ 27.007.)  Waiver of the List of Subcontractors and Suppliers. You are not required to waive the right granted by Section 53.256, Property Code, to receive from Powur an original or updated list of subcontractors and suppliers. By signing this Agreement, You agree to waive Your right to receive from Powur an original or  updated list of subcontractors and suppliers. Here we part ways with most value investors. A lot of good value investors refuse to use trailing-stop  losses. Instead, they hope to sell when stocks become too expensive. But in our experience, itâ€™s nearly impossible for most investors to know when  to sell. Therefore, we want to focus on buying at the right time. Then we simply admit that weâ€™re not going to sell at the optimal point. We just canâ€™t predict how high stocks will go. And we want to capture as much of that upside as possible. Using trailing stops allows us to do this. If youâ€™re not sure how to use them, please visit TradeStops.com for more information. Also, itâ€™s important to never give your stockbroker your stop- loss points. And never, ever base your stops on intraday prices. If you put your stops in the market (which is what happens when you give them to 170  your broker)... events like a flash-crash can wipe you out.  If you remain dedicated to only buying stocks at a discount from their in- trinsic value... if you become a connoisseur of value... and if you only make large investments when other investors are panicking, you should actually  find that itâ€™s easy to keep a cash reserve. But how many stocks should you own? Whatâ€™s reasonably diversified? I  recommend never owning more stocks than you can completely under- stand and follow.  A good test is: Can you explain the stocks in your portfolio and why you bought them (the elevator pitch) to a friend without using notes or look -  ing at your portfolio? If you canâ€™t, you donâ€™t know your investments well  enough to own them or youâ€™re trying to follow too many.  Youâ€™re not going to be able to find   more than a handful of extraordinary in -  vestments at any given time. Why own anything thatâ€™s not extraordinary?  Another good test for your portfolio is to make sure that thereâ€™s not a sin- gle position that could cost you more than 5% of the value of your overall  tle  success â€“ with exciting strategies, I hope youâ€™ll come around to the idea in  this guide. Once you come around and commit to a lifetime of accumulating elite, div- idend-paying businesses purchased at reasonable prices, youâ€™ll eventually have a beautiful view of your â€œinvestment backyardâ€... 242  At the end of your investment career, youâ€™ll have a large collection of elite,  dividend-paying businesses... throwing off regular cash dividends.  Youâ€™ll have an orchard of money trees in your backyard . The branches of your money trees will be heavy with fruit every year. One â€œtreeâ€ will yield 20% on your original investment... one will yield 25% on your original investment... one will yield 30% on your original invest- ment... and so on. Broad market corrections wonâ€™t concern you. The latest government dra- ma wonâ€™t concern you. Youâ€™ll sleep well at night knowing your elite businesses will continue to pay out regular cash dividends. Youâ€™ll have a large and growing portfolio of the worldâ€™s best soda compa- nies, the worldâ€™s best energy companies, the worldâ€™s best food companies, etc. Instead of a fancy art collection or a car collection, youâ€™ll have a money tree collection. For emphasis, letâ€™s go over it one last time...  If you commit to a lifetime of accumulating elite, dividend-pay- ing businesses purchased at reasonable prices, youâ€™re virtual-  ly guaranteed to build significant wealth in the stock market .  And you will build that wealth safely .  This is the worldâ€™s No. 1 way to invest for retirement. Itâ€™s the closest thing there is to having money trees growing in your back- yard. 243  â€” One Final Thought â€”  Think of These Steps as Insurance for a Storm  Please take the simple steps necessary to protect yourself and your family. I hope youâ€™ll take the research my team and I have spent an incredible amount of time and money preparing seriously. I know in my heart it  will be one of the best financial moves you ever make. And I want you to  remember one more imp ou try to do the best job you can do. If youâ€™re dealing with one of the principals of the business, it usually limits your risk. More often than not, theyâ€™re going to do whatâ€™s in the clientâ€™s best interest be- cause thatâ€™s in their long-term best interest, also.  The second key, according to Van, is generally to avoid buying any coins that are relatively new, like one that may have just been struck from the Franklin Mint ...  It usually takes 40 or 50 years for something to become â€œrareâ€... a true col -  lectible. So itâ€™s a gamble to buy something today hoping in 40 or 50 years 66 itâ€™s going to become desirable. Thereâ€™s simply no way to know whatâ€™s going to be popular 50 years from now.  Youâ€™re much better off buying a rare coin that has a long track record...  that has already been a popular collectible for many decades and has a large, well-established collector base. The more popular and the bigger the collector base, generally the more liquid the market for that coin is and the better the price will be when you decide you would like to sell.  The third key is to buy rare coins when prices may not have seen much movement for a period of time, or if the market corrects  significantly and leaves prices too low ...  Like in other markets, these are the times when youâ€™re most likely to find  rare coins trading at great values. Of course, the hardest thing to do is buy in a bear market. Itâ€™s not easy to be a contrarian and buy when things are cheap and undervalued... but thatâ€™s one of the keys to big returns. When  you buy a great asset at a great value, your chances of success go up expo - nentially.  The fourth key â€“ and this is a bit different than some other in - vestments â€“ is to â€œbuy what you likeâ€ ... If you buy a coin because itâ€™s beautiful, in great condition, and you really like it, chances are somebody else will like it for similar reasons. So thereâ€™s  an added dimension you donâ€™t find in many other assets.  The fifth and final key is the biggest considera s (birth certificate, passport, etc.) once  a year.  6 .   Do not hold bonds.  7.   Be cautious buying life insurance.  8 .   Own your own â€œasset-lightâ€ business.  9.   Focus your stock investing on â€œTrophy Assetsâ€ and capital-efficient  businesses. PART EIGHT  How to Own the Worldâ€™s Trophy Assets 109  â€” Chapter 1 â€”  The Most Profitable and Stable Form of Leveraged Investing  In mid-2007, private-equity firm Blackstone Group went public in a huge and highly publicized initial stock offering.  The public was so eager to buy the stock, bankers were able to push the  value of the firm to nearly $40 billion. Blackstone had roughly 1,500 em - ployees at the time. According to the stock market, these employees were worth $26.6 million each, making them the most valuable people in the history of capitalismâ€¦ at least, for a few months. Due to the outrageous valuation and the incredible hype, the stock soon cratered. It fell from more than $30 per share to less than $5 in a little  more than a year. We wrote at the time of the initial public offering (IPO)  that Blackstoneâ€™s shares were not safe. We saw the IPO as one of the most obvious signs of a general stock market peakâ€¦  Chief Executive Stephen Schwarzman and his partner Peter Peter -  son started this company in 1985 with $400,000. Theyâ€™ve worked  hard for 22 years. And theyâ€™re no dummies. Theyâ€™ve seen a top in the credit markets beforeâ€¦ and this time theyâ€™re cashing out.  â€“ The Stansberry Digest, June 17, 2007  The Blackstone IPO turned out to be the metaphoric bell ringing at the  top of the credit/housing/stock market bubble of 2004-2008. Within  only a few weeks of the IPO, the credit markets began to crater, making  it harder and more expensive for private-equity firms like Blackstone to get the financing they needed for their deals. Within a few months, credit  was simply not available at any price. The stockâ€™s share price collapsed.  It would be easy to write off the success of the private-equity funds in the 19

If a claim is not paid within a certain  time period, the claimant is required to file a mechanicâ€™s lien affidavit in the real property records in the county where the property is located. SOME CLAIMS MAY NOT BE VALID. When You receive a written notice of a claim or when a mechanicâ€™s lien affidavit is filed on Your property, You should know Your legal rights and responsibilities regarding the claim. Not all claims are valid. A notice of a claim by a subcontractor or supplier is required to be sent, and the mechanicâ€™s lien affidavit is required to be filed, within strict time periods. The notice and the affidavit must contain certain information. All  claimants may not fully comply with the legal requirements to collect on a claim. If You have paid the contractor in full before receiving a notice of a claim and have fully complied with the law regarding statutory retainage, You may not be liable for that claim. messages.content: que me cubre el seguro? que tipo de gastos medicos

El seguro de gastos mÃ©dicos cubre los siguientes gastos:

1. Primeros $100,000 pesos: La cobertura varÃ­a segÃºn el tipo de plan contratado. Para el plan Premium, se cubre el 50% de estos gastos. Para los planes Platino, Ãndigo, Ãmbar y Cuarzo, se cubre el 40%, 30%, 30% y 20% respectivamente.

2. Resto del gasto: Una vez superados los primeros $100,000 pesos, la cobertura sigue aplicando pero con un porcentaje menor. Para el plan Premium, se cubre el 25% del resto del gasto. Para los planes Platino, Ãndigo, Ãmbar y Cuarzo, se cubre el 20%, 15%, 15% y 10% respectivamente.

3. Tope de coaseguro: El tope de coaseguro varÃ­a segÃºn el porcentaje de coaseguro contratado. Para el coaseguro del 5% y 10%, el tope de coaseguro es de $75,500 pesos. Para el coaseguro del 15% y 20%, el tope de coaseguro es de $112,500 pesos.

Es importante tener en cuenta que estos porcentajes y topes aplican a la cobertura bÃ¡sica del seguro de gastos mÃ©dicos. TambiÃ©n es necesario revisar las condiciones generales del contrato de seguro para conocer las exclusiones y restricciones especÃ­ficas de la pÃ³liza.

messages.content: what do i have to be aware off from this contract as the home owner   Search for relevant information in the context below and use it to answer user questions exhaustively and deeply using numbered list and thorough analysis.  If the context does not provide relevant answer to the question, mention that PDF provided is not relevant to question and try to relate the question to the context.  Context: 34861  11/24/2021  11/21/2021 Page 1  TEXAS TERMS AND DISCLOSURES  KNOW YOUR RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES UNDER THE LAW. You are about to enter into a transaction to build a new home or remodel existing residential property. Texas law requires Your contractor to provide You with this brief overview of some of Your rights, responsibilities, and risks in this transaction. CONVEYANCE TO CONTRACTOR NOT REQUIRED. Your contractor may not require You to convey Your real property to Your contractor as a condition to the agreement for the construction of improvements on Your property. KNOW YOUR CONTRACTOR. Before You enter into Your agreement for the construction of improvements to Your real property, make sure that You have investigated Your contractor. Obtain and verify references from other people who have used the contractor for the type and size of construction project on Your property. GET IT IN WRITING. Make sure that You have a written agreement with Your contractor that includes: (1) a description of the work the contractor is to perform; (2) the required or estimated time for completion of the work; (3) the cost of the work or how the cost will be determined; and (4) the procedure and method of payment, including provisions for  statutory retainage and conditions for final payment. If Your contractor made a promise, warranty, or representation  to You concerning the work the contractor is to perform, make sure that promise, warranty, or representation  is specified in the written agreement. An oral promise that is not included in the written agreement may not be  enforceable under Texas law. READ BEFORE YOU SIGN. Do not sign any document before You have read and understood it. NEVER SIGN A DOCUMENT THAT INCLUDES AN UNTRUE STATEMENT. Take Your time in reviewing documents. If You borrow money from a lender to pay for the improvements, You are entitled to have the loan closing documents furnished to You for review at least one business day before the closing. Do not wa losing documents furnished to You for review at least one business day before the closing. Do not waive this requirement unless a  bona fide emergency or another good cause exists, and make sure You understand the documents before You sign  them. If You fail to comply with the terms of the documents, You could lose Your property. You are entitled to have Your own attorney review any documents. If You have any question about the meaning of a document, consult an attorney. GET A LIST OF SUBCONTRACTORS AND SUPPLIERS. Before construction commences, Your contractor is required to provide You with a list of the subcontractors and suppliers the contractor intends to use on Your project. Your contractor is required to supply updated information on any subcontractors and suppliers added after the list is provided. Haz siempre lo mÃ¡ximo que puedas   por mantener estos acuerdos, y pronto te resultarÃ¡ sencillo. Hoy es el principio de un nuevo sueÃ±o. 6 EL CAMINO TOLTECA HACIA LA LlBERTAD Romper viejos acuerdos  Todos hablan de libertad. Distintas personas, diferentes razas y distintos paÃ­ses luchan por la libertad en todo el mundo. Pero Â¿quÃ© es la libertad? En Estados Unidos decimos que vivimos en un paÃ­s libre. Sin embargo, Â¿somos realmente libres? Â¿Somos libres para ser quienes realmente somos? La respuesta es no, no somos libres. La verdadera libertad estÃ¡ relacionada con el espÃ­ritu humano: es la libertad de ser quienes realmente somos. Â¿QuiÃ©n nos impide ser libres? Si mantienes este acuerdo, viajarÃ¡s por todo el mundo con el corazÃ³n abierto por completo y nadie te herirÃ¡. DirÃ¡s: â€œTe amoâ€, sin miedo a que te rechacen o te ridiculicen. Si lo haces, aunque estÃ©s en medio del infierno, experimentarÃ¡s felicidad y paz interior. PermanecerÃ¡s en tu estado de dicha y el infierno no te afectarÃ¡ en absoluto. 4 EL TERCER ACUERDO No hagas suposiciones  El Tercer Acuerdo consiste en   no hacer suposiciones.  Tendemos a hacer suposiciones sobre todo. El problema es que,   al   hacerlo,   creemos   que   lo que suponemos   es cierto. JurarÃ­amos que es real. Hacemos suposiciones sobre lo que los demÃ¡s hacen o piensan -nos lo tomamos personalmente-, y despuÃ©s,   los   culpamos   y   r ar nuestras propias creencias; porque, aunque sepamos que no las escogimos, tambiÃ©n es cierto que las aceptamos. El acuerdo es tan fuerte, que incluso cuando sabemos que el concepto es errÃ³neo, sentimos la culpa, el reproche y la vergÃ¼enza que aparecen cuando actuamos en contra de esas reglas. De la misma forma que el gobierno tiene un CÃ³digo de Leyes que   dirige   el   sueÃ±o   de   la   sociedad,   nuestro   sistema   de creencias es el Libro de la Ley que gobierna nuestro sueÃ±o personal. Todas estas leyes existen en nuestra mente, creemos en ellas, y nuestro Juez interior lo basa todo en ellas. El Juez decreta y la VÃ­ctima sufre la culpa y el castigo. Pero Â¿quiÃ©n dice que este sueÃ±o sea justo? La verdadera justicia consiste en pagar sÃ³lo una vez por cada error. Lo que es verdaderamente  injusto   es pagar varias veces por el mismo error. Â¿CuÃ¡ntas veces pagamos por un mismo error? La respuesta es: miles de veces. El ser humano es el Ãºnico animal sobre la tierra que   paga   miles   d o, porque serÃ¡s inmune a Ã©l. AlcanzarÃ¡s   el   reino   de   los   cielos   con   este   acuerdo:   SÃ© impecable con tus palabras. 3 EL SEGUNDO ACUERDO No te tomes nada personalmente  Los tres acuerdos siguientes nacen, en realidad, del primero. El Segundo Acuerdo consiste en   no tomarte nada personalmente.  Suceda   lo   que   suceda   a   tu   alrededor,   no   te   lo   tomes personalmente. Utilizando un ejemplo anterior, si te encuentro en la calle y te digo: â€œÂ¡Eh, eres un estÃºpido!â€, sin conocerte, no me refiero a ti, sino a mÃ­. Si te lo tomas personalmente, tal vez te creas que eres un estÃºpido. QuizÃ¡ te digas a ti mismo: â€œÂ¿CÃ³mo lo sabe? Â¿Acaso es clarividente o es que todos pueden ver lo estÃºpido que soy?â€. Te   lo   tomas   personalmente   porque   estÃ¡s   de   acuerdo   con cualquier   cosa   que   se   diga.   Y   tan   pronto   como   estÃ¡s   de acuerdo, el veneno te recorre y te encuentras atrapado en el sueÃ±o del infierno. El motivo de que estÃ©s atrapado es lo que llamamos  cazador, un gran guerrero capaz de defender los Cuatro Acuerdos con tu vida. Tu felicidad, tu libertad, toda tu manera de vivir dependen de ello. Al principio, yo no creÃ­a que pudiera ser capaz de hacerlo. He fracasado muchas veces, pero me levantÃ© y seguÃ­ adelante. No me   compadece   de   mÃ­   mismo.   De   ninguna   manera   iba   a compadecerme de mÃ­ mismo. Dije: â€œSi me caigo, soy lo bastante fuerte, lo bastante inteligente, Â¡puedo hacerlo!â€. Me levantÃ© y seguÃ­ adelante. Me caÃ­ y seguÃ­ adelante, y adelante, y cada vez me resultÃ³ mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil. Sin embar Te dio una opiniÃ³n que llevaba tras ella todo el poder de sus palabras. Si aceptas esa opiniÃ³n, se convierte en un acuerdo, y entonces tÃº misma pones todo tu poder en esa opiniÃ³n, que se convierte en magia negra. Los hechizos de este tipo son difÃ­ciles de romper. La Ãºnica manera de deshacer un hechizo es llegar a un nuevo acuerdo que   se   base   en   la   verdad.   La   verdad   es   el   aspecto   mÃ¡s importante del hecho de ser impecable con tus palabras. La espada tiene dos filos: en uno estÃ¡n las mentiras que crean la magia negra, y en el otro, estÃ¡ la verdad que tiene el poder de deshacer los hechizos. SÃ³lo la verdad nos harÃ¡ libres. ------ Considera las relaciones humanas diarias, e imagÃ­nate cuÃ¡ntas veces nos lanzamos hechizos los unos a los otros con nuestras palabras. Con el tiempo, esto se ha convertido en la peor forma de magia negra: son los   chismes.  Los chismes son magia negra de la peor clase, porque son puro veneno. Aprendimos a contar chismes por acuerdo. De niÃ±os, nos nos transmitieron del sueÃ±o del planeta. La Ãºnica forma de almacenar informaciÃ³n es por acuerdo. El sueÃ±o externo capta nuestra atenciÃ³n, pero si no estamos de acuerdo, no almacenaremos esa informaciÃ³n. Los niÃ±os creen todo lo que dicen los adultos. EstÃ¡bamos de acuerdo con ellos, y nuestra fe era tan fuerte, que el sistema de creencias que se nos habÃ­a transmitido controlaba totalmente el sueÃ±o de nuestra vida.   No   escogimos   estas   creencias,   y   aunque   quizÃ¡   nos rebelamos contra ellas, no Ã©ramos lo bastante fuertes para que nuestra rebeliÃ³n triunfase. El resultado es que nos rendimos a las creencias mediante nuestro   acuerdo.  Llamo a este proceso â€œla domesticaciÃ³n de los seres humanosâ€. A travÃ©s de esta domesticaciÃ³n aprendemos a vivir y a soÃ±ar. En la domesticaciÃ³n humana, la informaciÃ³n del sue mente proporcional a la calidad e integridad de tus palabras. Cuando eres impecable con tus palabras, te sientes bien, eres feliz y estÃ¡s en paz. Puedes   trascender   el   sueÃ±o   del   infierno   sÃ³lo   con   llegar   al acuerdo de ser impecable con tus palabras. Ahora mismo estoy plantando una semilla en tu mente. El Primer Acuerdo cambiarÃ¡ el tipo de semillas para las que tu mente resulta fÃ©rtil.  SÃ© impecable con tus palabras.   Este es el primer acuerdo al que debes llegar si quieres ser libre, ser feliz y trascender el nivel de existencia del infierno. Es muy poderoso. Utiliza tus palabras apropiadamente.   EmplÃ©alas   para   compartir   tu   amor.   Usa   la magia blan ualquier ruido era inexistente; no era que la voz de su hija fuera horrible. DespuÃ©s de esto ya no cantÃ³   mÃ¡s,   porque   creÃ­a   que   su   voz   era   horrible   y   que molestarÃ­a a cualquier persona que la oyera. Summary of Key Points:

1. Texas law prohibits contractors from requiring property owners to convey their real property as a condition for construction agreements.

2. Before entering into an agreement, property owners should thoroughly investigate their contractor and obtain references from other clients.

3. It is important to have a written agreement with the contractor that clearly specifies the work to be performed, the timeline, cost, and payment terms. Any promises or warranties should also be included in the written agreement.

4. Property owners should carefully read and understand all documents before signing them. They should not sign any document that includes untrue statements.

5. Property owners who borrow money from a lender for the project are entitled to review the loan closing documents at least one business day before the closing. They should not waive this requirement unless there is a valid emergency or good cause.

6. Contractors are required to provide property owners with a list of subcontractors and suppliers involved in the project. Property owners can monitor the work and payments by reviewing statements from the lender and contractor.

7. Property owners should be aware of their rights and duties under Texas law, especially regarding construction defects. They should provide notice to the contractor of any defects and give the contractor an opportunity to inspect and cure the defect.

8. The agreement includes provisions for arbitration of disputes, waiving the right to a court or jury trial. Property owners should carefully review and understand this provision before agreeing to it.

9. The solar installation agreement includes details about the project, payment terms, financing options, and warranties. Property owners should carefully review and understand the terms of the agreement before signing it.

10. The agreement also includes a notice of cancellation, which allows property owners to cancel the transaction within three business days without penalty or obligation.

11. The agreement specifies that Powur is not responsible for unforeseen conditions or changes in energy savings. Property owners should consult legal and accounting professionals regarding any energy rebates or tax credits.

12. The agreement includes general terms and conditions, including provisions for access, unforeseen conditions, late payment fees, and limited warranties. Property owners should carefully review and understand these terms.

Extra Work and Change Orders become part of the contract once the order is prepared in writing and signed by the parties prior to the commencement of any work covered by the new change order. The order must describe the scope of the extra work or change, the cost to be added or subtracted from  the contract, and the effect the order will have on the schedule of progress payments. You may not require Powur to  perform extra or change order work without providing written authorization prior to the commencement of any work  covered by the new change order. Change order work is not enforceable against You unless the change order identifies  prior to commencement of any work covered by the new change order, the scope of the extra work or change, the cost  to be added or subtracted from the contract, and the effect the order will have on the schedule of progress payments or  the completi ting, operating, repairing, removing and replacing the Solar System or making any additions to the Project; (c) installing, using, and maintaining electric lines and inverters and meters necessary to interconnect the Solar System to Your existing electrical system at the Property and/or to Your utilityâ€™s electric distribution system; and (d) taking any other action reasonably necessary in connection with the construction, installation, operation, maintenance, removal, or repair of the Solar System. You permit Powur to erect temporary facilities, including but not limited to storage sheds and portable toilets, on the Property. Such temporary buildings will remain the property of Powur and will be removed at Powurâ€™s expense after completion of the Project. This access right shall continue for up to ninety (90) days after the later of the termination of this Agreement. During the term of this Agreement, You will ensure that Powurâ€™s access rights are preserved and shall not interfere with or permit any third party to interfere with such rights or access.  Permitting.   Powur will obtain any necessary municipal permits and will advance such costs on Your behalf. You agree to cooperate with Powur and to assist Powur in obtaining any necessary municipal permits. Accordingly, You hereby  appoint Powur, as well as any of its appropriate officers, employees, or agents, as Your attorney-in-fact, with full power of substitution, to sign in Your name, place, and stead any and all applications, affidavits, or any other documents required  or necessary to obtain, maintain, and/or transfer or convey municipal permits necessary to perform the Work, as fully and to all intents and purposes as You might or could do if personally present. This grant of a power of attorney is coupled with an interest. You agree that Powur will not be responsible for any error, negligence, or for any sort of act or omission not amounting to willful misconduct, arising out of the exercise of these rights  yment and any claims not made at or before such time will be deemed waived by You upon making final payment.  Attorneys Fees.   The prevailing party in any arbitration or litigation arising from this Agreement shall be entitled to the recovery of its reasonable costs and expenses of such proceeding, including expert witness fees and attorneysâ€™ fees.  Waiver . Any delay or failure of a party to enforce any of the provisions of this Agreement, including but not limited to any remedies listed in this Agreement, or to require performance by the other party of any of the provisions of this Agreement, shall not be construed to be a waiver of such provisions or a partyâ€™s right to enforce that provision or  affect the validity of this Agreement.  Time of the Essence.   The parties agree that time is of the essence in this Agreement.  Assignment and Transfer.   Your rights or obligations under this Agreement may not be assigned without Powurâ€™s express written consent. You agree to give Powur notice of any transfer of the Property (including the Solar System) at least thirty (30) days prior to such transfer if You desire to transfer any rights and obligations under this Agreement and/or the Limited Warranties to the transferee. In the event of any transfer of the Property prior to  full and final payment under this Agreement, You will remain liable for meeting all payment obligations under this  Agreement.  Entire Agreement.   This Agreement contains the partiesâ€™ entire agreement regarding the Project. There are no other agreements regarding this Agreement, either written or spoken. Any change to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties. Only an authorized representative of Powur may execute any change to this Agreement on behalf of Powur. If any portion of this Agreement is determined to be unenforceable or invalid, the remaining provisions shall be enforced in accordance with their terms or shall be interpreted or rewritten so as to make them enforceable g the Initial Period will remain the same as during the Initial Period. However, if during the Initial Period you elect to pay an amount that is less than the ITC of Your loan amount, Your monthly payment beginning upon conclusion of the Initial Period and throughout the rest of the term of Your loan will be increased to amortize the remaining principal balance on the loan. Conversely, if You make a payment greater than the ITC of Your loan amount during the Initial Period, Your monthly  payments following the conclusion of the Initial Period will be reduced to reflect the amortization of a lower principal  balance. Please carefully review the details of Your loan, including the payment amounts, provided in your Loan  Agreement. The Loan Agreement controls your finance transaction. Limited Warranties. title: give me a summary of key points disclosed here

messages.content: give me a summary of key points disclosed here   Search for relevant information in the context below and use it to answer user questions exhaustively and deeply using numbered list and thorough analysis.  If the context does not provide relevant answer to the question, mention that PDF provided is not relevant to question and try to relate the question to the context.  Context: 34861  11/24/2021  11/21/2021 Page 1  TEXAS TERMS AND DISCLOSURES  KNOW YOUR RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES UNDER THE LAW. You are about to enter into a transaction to build a new home or remodel existing residential property. Texas law requires Your contractor to provide You with this brief overview of some of Your rights, responsibilities, and risks in this transaction. CONVEYANCE TO CONTRACTOR NOT REQUIRED. Your contractor may not require You to convey Your real property to Your contractor as a condition to the agreement for the construction of improvements on Your property. KNOW YOUR CONTRACTOR. Before You enter into Your agreement for the construction of improvements to Your real property, make sure that You have investigated Your contractor. Obtain and verify references from other people who have used the contractor for the type and size of construction project on Your property. GET IT IN WRITING. Make sure that You have a written agreement with Your contractor that includes: (1) a description of the work the contractor is to perform; (2) the required or estimated time for completion of the work; (3) the cost of the work or how the cost will be determined; and (4) the procedure and method of payment, including provisions for  statutory retainage and conditions for final payment. If Your contractor made a promise, warranty, or representation  to You concerning the work the contractor is to perform, make sure that promise, warranty, or representation  is specified in the written agreement. An oral promise that is not included in the written agreement may not be  enforceable under Texas law. READ BEFORE YOU SIGN. Do not sign any document before You have read and understood it. NEVER SIGN A DOCUMENT THAT INCLUDES AN UNTRUE STATEMENT. Take Your time in reviewing documents. If You borrow money from a lender to pay for the improvements, You are entitled to have the loan closing documents furnished to You for review at least one business day before the closing. Do not wa losing documents furnished to You for review at least one business day before the closing. Do not waive this requirement unless a  bona fide emergency or another good cause exists, and make sure You understand the documents before You sign  them. If You fail to comply with the terms of the documents, You could lose Your property. You are entitled to have Your own attorney review any documents. If You have any question about the meaning of a document, consult an attorney. GET A LIST OF SUBCONTRACTORS AND SUPPLIERS. Before construction commences, Your contractor is required to provide You with a list of the subcontractors and suppliers the contractor intends to use on Your project. Your contractor is required to supply updated information on any subcontractors and suppliers added after the list is provided. Your contractor is not required to supply this information if You sign a written waiver of Your rights to receive this information. MONITOR THE WORK. Lenders and governmental authorities may inspect the work in progress from time to time for their own purposes. These inspections are not intended as quality control inspections. Quality control is a matter for You and Your contractor. To ensure that Your home is being constructed in accordance with Your wishes and  specifications, You should inspect the work Yourself or have Your own independent inspector review the work in  progress. MONITOR PAYMENTS. If You use a lender, Your lender is required to provide You with a periodic statement showing the money disbursed by the lender from the proceeds of Your loan. Each time Your contractor requests payment from You or Your lender for work performed, Your contractor is also required to furnish You with a disbursement statement that lists the name and address of each subcontractor or supplier that the contractor intends to pay from the requested funds. Review these statements and make sure that the money is being properly disbursed. CLAIMS BY SUBCONTRACTORS AND SUPPLIERS. U IGATED IN A COURT OR JURY TRIAL. BY INITIALING IN THE SPACE BELOW YOU ARE GIVING UP YOUR JUDICIAL RIGHTS TO DISCOVERY AND APPEAL, UNLESS THOSE RIGHTS ARE SPECIFICALLY INCLUDED IN THE â€œARBITRATION OF DISPUTESâ€ PROVISION. IF YOU REFUSE TO SUBMIT TO ARBITRATION AFTER AGREEING TO THIS PROVISION, YOU MAY BE COMPELLED TO ARBITRATE UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE FEDERAL ARBITRATION ACT OR OTHER APPLICABLE LAWS. YOUR AGREEMENT TO THIS ARBITRATION PROVISION IS VOLUNTARY. messages.content: give me a summary of this text  Search for relevant information in the context below and use it to answer user questions exhaustively and deeply using numbered list and thorough analysis.  If the context does not provide relevant answer to the question, mention that PDF provided is not relevant to question and try to relate the question to the context.  Context: erg's annual Tech Summit. So you've been  traveling a ton. Yeah. What's the like eat, sleep, medit ate, yoga, tech rou5ne. There was like no  medita5on or yoga on the en5re trip and almost no exercise. That was tough. I slept fine  actually. Was the goal more listening or explaining? The goal was more listening. It ended up  with more explaining than we   expected. We ended up mee5ng many, many world leaders and  talked about the sort of the need for global regula5on and that was more explaining. The  listening was super valuable. I came back with like a hundred handwriTen pages of notes. I  heard that you   do handwriTen notes. I do handwriTen notes. What happens to the handwriTen  notes? Well, in this case, like I dis5lled it into here were the top 50 pieces of like feedback from  our users and what we need to go off and do. But there's like a lot of thin gs when you get  people in person like face - to - face or over a drink or whatever where people really will just like  say, you know, here is like my very harsh feedback on what you're doing wrong and what I want  to be different. You didn't go to China or Russi a. I spoke remotely in China, but not Russia.  Should we be worried about them? And where they are on AI? Or what they do with it? Yeah, I  would love to know more precisely where they are. That would be helpful. We have I think very  imperfect informa5on th ere. So how has ChatGPT changed your own behavior? There's like a lot  of liTle ways and then kind of one big thought. The liTle ways are, you know, like on this trip, for  example, the transla5on was a lifesaver. I also use it if I'm trying to write some thing. Which I  write a lot, to never publish, just like for my own thinking. And I find that I write faster and can  think more somehow, so it's like a great uns5cking tool. But then the big way is I see the path  towards this just being like my super assis tant for all of my cogni5ve work. Super assistant. You  know we've talked about rela5onships fits, the access to it, the governance of it belongs to humanity as a whole. If this really  works, it's quite a powerful technology. You should not trust one company and certainly not one  person with it. r assis tant for all of my cogni5ve work. Super assistant. You  know we've talked about rela5onships with chatbots. Did you see this as something that people  could get emo5onally aTached to? And how do you feel about that? I think language models in  general are   something that people are gefng emo5onally aTached to and, you know, I have a  complex set of thoughts about that. I personally find it strange. I don't want it for myself. I have  a lot of concerns. I don't want to be the kind of people telling other p eople what they can do  with tech, but it seems to me like something you need to be careful with. You've talked about  how you are constantly in rooms full of people going holy . Yeah. What was the last holy moment? It was like very interes5ng to get out of   the SF echo chamber, whatever you wanna  call it, and see like the ways in which the holy concerns were the same everywhere. And also  the ways they're different. So like everywhere people are like, the rate of change is really fast.  You know, what is this   gonna do to the economy, good and bad. There's change, and change  brings anxiety for people. There's a lot of anxiety out there. There's a lot of fear. The  comparisons to nuclear, the comparisons to bio weapons. Are those fair or is that overdrama5c?  Ther e is a lot of anxiety and fear, but I think there's way more excitement out there. I think like  with any very powerful technology, synthe5c, bio, and nuclear, two of those, AI is a third, there  are major downsides we have to manage to be able to get the u psides. And with this  technology, I expect the upsides to be far greater than anything we have seen. And the poten5al  downsides also super bad. So we do have to manage through those, but the quality of  conversa5on about how to produc5vely do that has go Ten so much beTer so fast. Like I went  into the trip somewhat op5mis5c and I finished it super op5mis5c. Yeah. So is your bunker  prepped and ready to go for the AI apocalypse? A bunker e  a liTle bit or a lot. We have a new tool. What are we all gonna do when we have nothing to do?  I don't think we're ever gonna have nothing to do. I think what we have to do may change, you  know, like what you and I do for our jobs   would not strike people from a few thousand years ago  as real work, but we found new things to want and to do and ways to feel useful to other people  and get fulfillment and create. And that will never stop. But probably I hope you and I look, you  know, i f we could look at the world a few hundred years in the future, be like, wow, those  people have it so good. I can't believe they call this stuff work. It's so trivial. So we're not gonna  be all just laying on the beach ea5ng bonbons. Some of us will and m ore power to people who  want to do that. Do you think in your heart of hearts that the world is gonna be more fair and  more equitable? I do. I do. I think that technology is fundamentally an equalizing force. It needs  partnership from society and our ins5 tu5ons to get there. But if we can, like my big picture,  highest level, like zoom all the way out, view of the next decade is that the cost of intelligence  and the cost of energy come way, way down. And if those two things happen, it helps everyone  which   is great, but I think it liAs up the floor a lot. So where do you wanna take OpenAI next?  We want to keep making beTer and beTer, more capable models, and make them available  more widely and less expensive. What about the field of AI in general? There's   many people  working on this, so we don't get to take the field anywhere, but we're preTy happy with our  contribu5on. Like we think we have nudged the field in a way that we're proud of. So we're  working on new things too. What are the new things? They'r e s5ll in progress. Is there room for  startups in this world? Totally. I mean we were a startup not very long ago. But you're almost  already an incumbent. Of course. But when we started, like you could have as kind of one of the reasons why I think this  moving from autopilot to this co - pilot hopefully gives us more control, whether it's as parents or  more importantly, even as children. We shou ld of course be very, very watchful of what  happens. But at the same 5me, I think this genera5on of bots and this genera5on of AI probably just go from engagement to giving us more agency to learn. I wanna ask about jobs because  obviously, MicrosoA mak es soAware that helps people do their jobs. And I wonder if AI - laden  soAware will put some people out of jobs. Sam Altman has this idea that AI is going to create  this kind of utopia and generate wealth that's gonna be enough to cut everyone a decent siz ed  check, but eliminate some jobs. Do you agree with that? You know, look, I mean, you know,  from Canes, to I guess Altman, they've all talked about the two day work week and I'm looking  forward to it. But the point is, yes, there's gonna be some changes i n jobs, there's gonna be  some places where there'll be wage pressure, there will be opportuni5es for increased wages  because of increased produc5vity. We should look at it all, and at the same 5me, being very  clear - eyed about any displacement risk. At t he center of a poten5ally tectonic shiA in job  crea5on is Sam Altman. He's promised that AI will create a kind of utopia when it joins the  workforce, while also raising alarms about the dangers. Signing his name to statements warning  of the risk of ex5 nc5on. For many, the upsides of AI are hard to believe. The fear that AI could  take their jobs in part led to the prolonged writers and actors strike in Hollywood. ChatGPT is a  moron type of system, a moronic type of system. It doesn't really write great   stories. Over the  summer, Altman traveled the world to talk about the promise and peril of AI. I caught up with  him when he returned to San Francisco at Bloomberg's annual Tech Summit. So you've been  traveling a ton. Yeah. What's the like eat, sleep, medit a o like really push ourselves to say, okay GPT4, you kno w, not a risk  like you're talking about there but how sure are we the GPT - 9 won't be? And if it might be, even  if there's a small percentage, chance of it being really bad, like that deserves great care. And if  there is that small percentage chance, why ke ep doing this at all? Like why not stop? I mean, a  bunch of reasons. A, I think that the upsides here are tremendous. You know, opportunity for  everyone on earth to have a beTer quality educa5on than basically anyone can get today, that  seems like really   important. And that'd be a bad thing to stop. Medical care, and what's I think  gonna happen there, and making that available like truly globally. That's gonna be  transforma5ve. The scien5fic progress we're gonna see. I'm a big believer that like real  su stainable improvements in quality of life come from scien5fic and technological progress, and  I think we're gonna have a lot more of that. So there are all the obvious benefits and you know, I  think it'd be good to end poverty, but we goTa manage through   the risk to get there. I also think  at this point, given how much people see the economic benefits and poten5al, no company  could stop it. I think even you would acknowledge you have an incredible amount of power at  this moment in 5me. Why should we tru st you? You shouldn't. Like, you know, I don't, as you've  know me for a long 5me, public talking, like I'd rather be in the office working. But I think at this  moment in 5me, people deserve basically as much 5me asking ques5ons as they want, and I'm  tr ying to show up and do it. But more to that, no one person should be trusted here. The board  can fire me, I think that's important. I think the board over 5me needs to get like democra5zed  to all of humanity. There's many ways that could be implemented.   We think this technology, the  benefits, the access to it, the governance of it belongs to humanity as a whole. If this really  works,  ago. But you're almost  already an incumbent. Of course. But when we started, like you could have asked the same  ques5on. In fact, people did. In   fact, I myself wondered, like, is it possible to take on Google and  DeepMind or have they already won? And they clearly haven't. Yeah, like I think there's a lot, it's  always easy to kind of count yourself out as the startup, but startups keep doing their   thing.  Well, nobody's coun5ng you out, so I guess that's a good thing. I guess so. The one and only  person who's gonna be deciding our futures. I don't think so. So you have been everywhere in  like the last few months. That was a long trip. It's like a v ery special experience to just go talk to  people that are users, developers, also world leaders interested in AI like all day every day for so  long. In the middle of all this, you signed a 22 word statement warning about the dangers of AI.  It reads, "Mi5g a5ng the risk of ex5nc5on from AI should be a global priority alongside other  societal - scale risks such as pandemics and nuclear war." Connect the dots for us here. How do  we get from a cool chatbot to the end of humanity? Well, we're planning not to. T hat's the  hope, but there's also the fear. I mean, I think there's many ways it could go wrong, but we work  with powerful technology that can be used in dangerous ways very frequently in the world. And  I think we've developed over the decades good safety s ystem prac5ces in many categories. It's  not perfect and this won't be perfect either, things will go wrong. The main thing that I feel is important about this technology is that we are on an exponen5al curve and a rela5vely steep  one. And human intui5o n for exponen5al curves is like really bad in general. It clearly was not  that important in our evolu5onary history. And so I think we have to, given that we all have that  weakness, I think we have to like really push ourselves to say, okay GPT4, you kno w, not a risk  like you're talking about the Microsoft & OpenA I CEOs: Dawn of the AI  Wars  I've been covering this industry a long 5me and there is always some new, new thing that big  tech is chasing. First it was self - driving cars, and then it was the Metaverse, and now everyone is  all in on AI. There's one big tech giant that's made it clear   it's not missing out. So welcome to  MicrosoA headquarters in Redmond, Washington where they have made a massive investment  in OpenAI. They are already off to the races integra5ng this new technology, but winning is a  totally different story. I'm about to   go talk to MicrosoA CEO Satya Nadella about why he thinks  he can do it. Thank you for coming. And I haven't seen you in person in so long. I know, it's been  ages. MicrosoA is a household name that totally revolu5onized how we work over 30 years ago.  Wi ndows, Word, Excel, PowerPoint. These products turned the soAware maker into a  behemoth, put the big in big tech, and made MicrosoA's co - founder Bill Gates and its next CEO,  Steve Balmer, billionaires. But in the nine5es the US government accused Micros oA of being a  monopoly. And then the company seTled a massive an5trust suit. For over a decade, MicrosoA  stock flatlined. Then came Satya Nadella, the guy MicrosoA hoped would make the company  cool again. This company's had three CEOs, they're all rig ht here. This is all... Nadella  resurrected MicrosoA as a power player in the market for business soAware and cloud  compu5ng. Then posi5oned it at the forefront of the AI revolu5on. Largely thanks to a massive  investment in OpenAI. MicrosoA is now Op enAI's main commercial partner, trading powerful  servers and billions of dollars for access to ChatGPT, sparking new life into old products,  especially their languishing search engine. It's not without its hiccups. We'll talk to OpenAI CEO  Sam Altman in a   moment, but first this new AI chatbot is helping Satya in some surprising ways.  Have you been playing around with it a lot? Yeah. Like fun stuff.  g Satya in some surprising ways.  Have you been playing around with it a lot? Yeah. Like fun stuff. Discovery? I am super verbose  and polite now in email responses. It's watching. The AI is always watching. It   is fun. Like the guy  who leads our office team, and I was responding to him and he was like, "What is this, man? You  were like so pleasant." Yeah, it's sort of very habit forming in the sense that once you get used  to having chat, even if I'm using it one,   because a lot of 5mes I'm just naviga5ng, using search as  a naviga5onal tool. But once you get used to it, you kind of feel like I goTa have these rails.  MicrosoA has been working on AI for decades. And chatbots actually aren't anything new, but  all   of of a sudden everyone is saliva5ng. Why do you think the moment for AI is now? AI has  been here. In fact, it's mainstream, right? I mean search is an AI product. Even the current  genera5on of search. Every news aggrega5on, recommenda5on, YouTube, or   e - commerce, or  TikTok are all AI products, except they're all, I would say, today's genera5on of AI is all autopilot.  In fact, it's a black box that is dicta5ng in fact how our aTen5on is focused. Whereas going  forward, the thing that's most exci5ng a bout this genera5on of AI is perhaps we move from  autopilot to copilot, where we actually prompt it. How transforma5ve a change do you think  this will be in how we work? I think that probably the biggest difference maker will be business  chat. Because if   you think about the most important database in any company is the database  underneath all of your produc5vity soAware. Except that data is all siloed today. But now I can  say, "oh, I'm going to meet this customer can you tell me the last 5me I met them ? Can you bring up all the documents that are wriTen up about this customer and summarize it so that I'm  current on what I need to be prepped for?" How do you make sure it's not Clippy 2.0, that it is  helpful? Deligh`ul. Doesn't wanna make  aking big tech bigger. Company's not for sale. Like I don't know how to  be more clear than that. We have a great rela5onship with 'em, I think that these like big major  partnerships between tech companies usually don't work. This is an example of it working really  well. We're like super grateful for it. Have you talked to El on at all behind the scenes?  Some5mes. What do you guys talk about? I mean it's gefng heated in the public. Yeah I mean  we talk about like a super wide variety of important and totally trivial stuff. Why do you think  he's so frustrated or kind of, I mea n, it's almost, there's some aTacking going on in a way. You  should ask him. I would like to know. I'd like to beTer understand it. I don't think this is in the  top hundred most important things happening related to AI right now, for what it's worth. Is  there any aspect of our lives that you think AI should never touch? My mom always used to say  never say never, never say always. And and I think that's like generally good advice. If I made a  predic5on now, I'm sure it could end up being wrong in some sub tle way. I think AI is going to touch most aspects of our lives and then there will be some parts that stay surprisingly the  same. But those kind of predic5ons are humbling and very easy to get wrong.
